title: Finbar buys new site for fourth Perth CBD project
text:
Fairfield fiesta

A private investor has splashed out $6.5 million for a warehouse in Fairfield East in Sydney's west at auction.

The 1070sq m building on a 5574sq m concrete site at 17 Lisbon Street was sold with a 12-month leaseback to private company Carways at an annual net rent of $280,000.

CBRE’s Elijah Shakir and John Tsoutsa were involved.

Small but dear

A tiny 5sq m hole-in-the-wall cafe in the Sydney CBD has sold for $921,000.

Private investor Dennis Nanis sold the property at 229 Macquarie Street near the law courts precinct to another investor. It is leased for 18 years and includes the use of a 38sq m kitchen and storage space on fourth floor of the building.

Savills' Nick Lower, Selin Ince and Tom Tuxworth negotiated the record sale of $184,200 a square metre.

Advertisement

A hole-in-the-wall coffee shop at 229 Macquarie Street, Sydney, has been sold for $921,000.

Deer Park deal

A private owner has purchased a newly built office-warehouse at 7 Zacara Court, Deer Park in Melbourne for $1.26 million.

The 724sq m warehouse and 234sq m office has a container-height roller door, three-phase power and 11 parking spaces on a fully fenced site.

Knight Frank’s Steve Jones and Joel Davy brokered the deal.

Braeside buy

Private investors have traded an 878sq m office-warehouse in Woodlands Industrial Estate at 57 Mills Road, Braeside in Melbourne for $1.35 million at a net yield of 6.22 per cent.

Knight Frank’s Adrian Garvey and Steven Salopek sold the property.

Advertisement

Warehouse sale

A Melbourne developer has paid $3.5 million for a 358sq m warehouse at 4-12 Langridge Street in Melbourne's Collingwood at a net yield of 2.3 per cent for future development.

The property was sold with a five-year lease expiring in March 2022 with options, although a notice to develop will null the option.

Teska Carson’s Luke Bisset, Matthew Feld and George Takis managed the auction.

Enoggera development

A local developer has snapped up a 3077sq m site at 347 Wardell Street and 185-197 Samford Road in Brisbane's Enoggera for $1.8 million with plans for a new commercial development.

The site, six kilometres north of the CBD, is close to a train station.

JLL's Andrew Havig and Sam Byrne acted on the transaction.

Advertisement

Part leaseback

Brisbane-based Triumph Investment Group has acquired a 1678sq m office-warehouse complex at 137 Ingram Road in Acacia Ridge for $2.2 million.

The property comprises three buildings on a 10,117sqm site.

Triumph plans to lease the building after a refurbishment.

Colliers International's Levi Maxwell and Philip Stephens negotiated a leaseback on part of the property for the previous owner.

Submissions to stan@afr.com
description: A private investor has also splashed out $6.5 million for a warehouse in Fairfield East in Sydney's west at auction.
